text: The 2014 Porsche Carrera Cup Italia season was the eighth Porsche Carrera Cup Italy season. It began on 10 May in Misano and finished on 26 October in Monza, after seven rounds with two races at each event. Matteo Cairoli won the drivers' championship driving for Antonelli Motorsport, which won the teams' championship. ==Teams and drivers== {|class="wikitable" style="font-size: 85%;" !Team ! !Drivers !Class !Rounds |- | Heaven Motorsport | 1 | Enrico Fulgenzi | | 4-7 |- |rowspan=3| Dinamic Motorsport |rowspan=2| 4 | Giovanni Berton | | 1-5, 7 |- | Alessandro Bonacini | | 6 |- | 67 | Alex de Giacomi |align=center| M | All |- |rowspan=3| Ghinzani Arco Motorsport | 8 | Alberto de Amicis | | All |- | 22 | Matteo Torta | | 2 |- | 81 | Marco Cassarà |align=center| M | 1, 3–7 |- |rowspan=3| Ebimotors | 9 | Edoardo Liberati |align=center| S | All |- |rowspan=2| 23 | Vito Postiglione | | 1-2, 4-7 |- | Massimo Monti | | 3 |- |rowspan=2| Cardeco Racing | 11 | Gianluca Giraudi | | All |- | 55 | Glauco Solieri |align=center| M | 3-4, 6 |- | Tsunami Racing Team | 13 | Oleksandr Gaidai | | All |- |rowspan=2| Sportec Motorsport | 14 | Rinat Salikhov | | All |- | 15 | Ilya Melnikov |align=center| S | All |- |rowspan=4| Antonelli Motorsport | 16 | Matteo Cairoli |align=center| S | All |- | 58 | Angelo Proietti |align=center| M | All |- | 64 | Pietro Negra |align=center| M | All |- | 90 | Davide Roda |align=center| M | 1-5 |- | GT Motorsport by Autotecnica Tadini | 91 | Walter Ben |align=center| M | All |} {| class="wikitable" style="font-size: 85%;" |- !
